name: SHOGUN: Total War™ - Collection
description: SHOGUN: Total War™ is the first, original title in a 15 year series of award-winning strategy games. This Collection Edition also includes the Mongol Invasion Expansion Pack.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, or Windows 7 Processor: 1 Ghz or faster processor Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9 graphic card DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 955 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, or Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: 1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster 32-bit (x86) or 64-bit (x64) processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9 graphics device with WDDM 1.0 or higher driver DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2 GB available space Additional Notes: 1 gigabyte (GB) RAM (32-bit) or 2 GB RAM (64-bit)

reviews.review_text: Yep CA did the impossible and released Shogun originial onto steam .. Can we get 1000 rate ups for a steam workshop for this anicent masterpiece .. i know everyone wants to see a remastered graphics mod :)

While perhaps vastly inferior to the newer Total War titles such as Shogun 2, this was after all what started it and despite owning the original CD (with case and book and everything) I bought this as soon as I saw it on Steam. It's still a hell of a fun game with loads of hours possible before you. A good buy, especially at this price.

The best title in the series. Low amount of different units, but extremely deep combat. You are able to win battles with just moving your army around into better positions and demoralizing the enemy. The only RTS where you are punished for micromanaging your units - it will just tire them and you will lose strength. Loving it :) Try to read Sun Tzu 'The Art of War', it will really help you get better in this game.  Graphical glitches seem to be solved (No menu flicker).

The best TW game ever made, played for 1.000 hours when it came out back in the day. Glad to have it again and it works on win 7 this time.  It is an old game so don´t expect a nice graphics game by today´s standard but back when it was first released it was really great. This game has the best video´s of agents ever in a TW game. Just play and see ;)

Not the best game of the series but you can play it for to observe how series have developed itself throughout years. Also, Mongol Invasion expansion pack is really hard and challenging. Definitely worth buying and playing.
not a great game, but for its time far ahead of others.

Still some compatibility issues, but I've never played this stable before (not even with the original game in Windows XP). Working great in Windows 8.1 and modern hardware; just finished two full campaigns in expert :).

One of the best classics of all time. I dont remember the game being so stiff ( Thats what she said) but that is easily something anyone who´s played a older total war game should get used to. Overall i rate this game 12/10 just for old memories :) Btw im playing this on max ( if you can call it max setttings) on a 4-5 year old laptop. Should you get this game then you might ask? ¨Hell Yes¨ Nostalgia at its finest!
I used to play this game religiously and i just spent 10 hours playing a campaign. It's still a great game despite being almost 20 years old. Need to play the others now.

Got this from some bundle, it's positively ancient but supports 1080p resolution and runs on Windows 7 64bit. Unless you have massive nostalgia, there is nothing good here today except the music track of the credits screen :)

An epic game on Steam! Yay!  But no! It does not run. I could not pass the launcher screen. It says 'Graphics card not supported'. So what is the meaning of 'being on Steam' anyway? Do not buy it until this is fixed! Alas, Steam and CA! Shamefur dispray!

I bought this as the original never worked on Windows 10. This worked fine and I was overjoyed. Trouble is, it no longer works, keeps crashing like the original. If you haven't bought it already then don't; Shogun Total War does NOT work on Windows 10 any longer. (December 2016) and I doubt anyone will release a fix unless 1,000's of players mention it.
